Class JwtTokenProvider

java.lang.Object
com.example.card_management_system.security.JwtTokenProvider
@Component public class JwtTokenProvider extends Object
Service responsible for generating, validating, and extracting information from JSON Web Tokens (JWT). This class provides methods to create a JWT token for authentication, retrieve the email of the user from a token, and validate the integrity of a token.

The JWT token is signed with a secret key and contains user information such as email and role.

  • Method Details

    • generateToken

      public String generateToken(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
      Generates a JWT token for the authenticated user. The token contains the user's email and role, and is signed using the configured secret key. The token expires after the specified expiration time.
      Parameters:
      authentication - the Authentication object containing the user details
      Returns:
      the generated JWT token as a String

    • getEmailFromToken

      public String getEmailFromToken(String token)
      Extracts the email address from the provided JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token
      Returns:
      the email of the user contained in the token

    • getClaimsFromToken

      public io.jsonwebtoken.Claims getClaimsFromToken(String token)
      Extracts all claims (user data) from the provided JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - the JWT token
      Returns:
      a Claims object containing all the information from the token

    • validateToken

      public boolean validateToken(String authToken)
      Validates the provided JWT token. It checks whether the token is correctly signed and whether it has expired.
      Parameters:
      authToken - the JWT token to validate
      Returns:
      true if the token is valid, false otherwise
